title: Aatrox need some serious balance work
body:
Aatrox is mostly fine early game, and is kit is okay but...
You can build him tanky, full dmg, a hybrid of the two, but he can't do any of those things efficently.

If you build hybrid, lategame you will do no dmg and you dont resist much compared to other bruisers, if you build full damage you do good early but then you get instashotted and you lategame dmg is suboptimal anyway. If you build full tannk you do 0 dmg and lategame you will get pretty much isntashotted anyway...

I don't know what is the couse of this but if he is intended to be a bruiser like champion, he is off the mark in terms of balance.

replies.body: I agree that he is in a bad place role wise, as he is unsure what he wants to be, but I find it completly infuriating the way his q interacts with any cc at all, you literally can't jump away from anything, the animation takes so long u can't dodge wth it and seems to tell the game you're still in the place you jumped from until u land back on the ground. It is really really clunky when it comes to trying to get out of orianna ult and viktors w stun, and what looks to be a great tool to escape ganks or jungle invades is actually rubbish.

I think the idea with his Q is that it isn't supposed to be an escape tool.  Nothing about Aatrox's lore or VO make it seem like he would have or want an escape.  Aatrox isn't some cowardly Tryndamere spinning away from a fight, Aatrox literally dives into combat.
I hate this kind of reasoning. Balance and the ability to enjoy playing should always go over the whims of lore.

I honestly prefer Aatrox having bad escape mechanics, mostly for the same reason I don't like playing Lee Sin.  Aatrox feels like a challenge to play because you have to be careful to not make any mistakes so you think about things before you act (or just throw thought to the wind and go ham because that is a lot of fun too).  I feel Aatrox is more fun because he has no get out of jail free cards.
As soon as he is in a good spot, I'll be all for adding windows of opportunity, but right now Aatrox isn't in a good place and that would help get him to where he needs to be.

The problem is when Aatrox was dominant, he was DOMINANT. He was a right pain in the ass for a while there. Most of this is because a little bit of tankiness and his W's triple-strength heal when below 50% health made him practically unkillable on top of his passive. To buff Aatrox, a few things need to happen.

1. W's heal needs to be adjusted to +2% strength for each 1% Health missing, so he only gets the truly massive heals at low health. Being at 50% Health still grants him a hefty 100% bonus on his heal, but he can no longer just maintain at 50% forever.

2. Aatrox's base damage need to be chopped down a tad, but he needs far, far better scalings. 60% bonus AD on BOTH of his basic damaging abilities?

A few other issues I'd consider tweaking:

1. W only working ever 3rd attack gimps Aatrox's damage output for short trades. W should apply (obviously not at current numbers) to each swing. Saving up for a hopeful burst with harassment doesn't really work with melee champs, so give him more reliable power.

2. Blood Well and the health costs on Aatrox's abilities are currently...very poorly designed. It rewards him for quickly filling his bar for engagements, which requires health, which cuts into his damage and reduces his trading ability as he drops in health. Just...I don't even. I don't know how, but the entire system needs to be scrapped and go back to the drawing board. None of it feels like this ancient avatar of war.

You will melt before you heal from your third attack.

People don't understand aatrox.  If you are getting "instabursted" lategame, that means you haven't adjusted your playstyle to your build and your team.  
Before i start my explanation of how you play aatrox, I'm going to tell you the most important thing not to do... DO NOT initiate fights. That is why you are being instabursted.

There's four key aspects to keep in mind while playing aatrox.

 What is your team comp like?  Did you get fed?  What is their team comp like?  How did you build
  
I usually wouldnt bring aatrox onto any team that doesn't already have a strong initiator tank(Amumu, Mao, Leona) because it forces you to build very tanky so that you can take on the role of a tank, and that isn't his strongest role.  if this is the case, you have to keep in mind that just because you are built as a tank, it doesn't mean you just jump into the enemy team whenever you can land a q, you will usually need to wait for your mage to make a pick, or counterengage on their tank with an effective bork frozen mallet combo.  Whenever i build this I consider myself the guardian for my team.  When the enemy tank/ bruiser/assassin jumps in, I q them, pop my ult, and slow them with my e and auto's. This gives your team plenty of time to position, and focus the now perma slowed attacker, while you are probably at the front of the battle.  You will be tanky enough to outlast him with your randuins, spirit visage, possible GA and heals.  you can now turn on the enemy( you will probably die, but as long as you CC'd the enemy carries after you killed off their first attacker your team will probably be able to kill the valuable targets with their tank killed off, and you come back to life, ready to disrupt the enemy in the final stages of the battle.

Did you get fed? I win my lane 90% of the time with aatrox so probably, yes.  Your first item should always be either a hydra or bork.  I'm not sure how to explain when i decide to go which one, it just depends on who you're lane matchup and how the enemy team comp is. If you are fed, the second item is crucial to how you will develop into the lategame. I look at my team and i say, ok does my team need utility? frozen mallet as a second item will provide lots of utility will also helping me snowball the midgame with extreme chase potential. Is the enemy team naturally beefy? last whisper.  Do you need to be tankier? I like to buy just the wardens mail for the armor, and then complete spirit visage.  It gives you all around more solid defenses while also increasing your heals. Is your team lacking in physical damage in general?(ex. blue build ez has lots of utility, but doesn't put out as much upfront damage as a vayne.) I might build a phantom dancer or an IE(IE only if you have bork instead of hyrda) This is going to give you all the damage you need, but you need to keep in mind that until you get some tanky items, you will pop like a balloon if you get focused, so you need to use the range from your ult to your advantage in teamfights. Never jump in unless the fight is almost over.

tldr if you think aatrox isn't good you probably haven't put in the time to learn what you should and shouldn't do with him.

I'm wondering why when you have 32/30 W/L with aatrox that you believe he's in a great spot. This is a super cereal question. Now, I'm not saying what you're saying about him isn't true, but even so, why defend his current state when as your main champ you are obviously struggling with him?

To be honest, the skill inconsistency of gold is ridiculous. I can stomp my laner extremely hard, but if my botlane goes 0/10 there's nothing aatrox can do if he doesn't have a team behind him.  he takes all the focus and crumbles.
He's in exactly the same place as every other melee AD carry... If you survive til 45 mins, you win the game.

I really wish his q wasn't canceled by the wind blowing on the other side of the map. Jungle Aatrox is an absolute joke. He can do a lot ni JG but his ability to attack enemy champions effeciently is so low since his slow deteriorates, hard to aim, and his Q as I've said is short and unreliable.
I think if they lower the health cost of his w and tweak his ad and armor/mr scaling/lvl he'll be fine. But he's so weak its not even fun to play him.

If they gave him some way to buff his allies when he uses his abilities then they could turn him into a Fighter/Support or something. As others have said, he's weak as a tank or a fighter but what if they made it so like... if he procs his W on an enemy then not only does it heal him, it bolsters his allies resistances for a short time, if he was using it for damage then it would instead reduce the cds of his allies abilities by a small amount and increase their attackspeed. When he uses his E, it leave behind a trail that bolsters movespeed for allies that run over it, and when he activates his ult it would give a temporary shield to all allies in the area that's strength is greater if he hits more enemy champions with it.

He's fairly weak right now, but they have him that way because of his potential to be abusive, if they gave him utility though, then it would mean his solo power is kept in line but he would at least have the potential to be strong through his benefits to others.

I build Aatrox as a hyper drain tank

BotRK, Hydra, BT, Zephyr/Mercurial, Beserker's, Spirit Visage. He gains so much freaking sustain per auto that he's impossible to kill 1on1. Then I just sit and split push the entire game.
Yea, he has clear weaknesses but doesn't really excel at anything.

He's stronger than you might think simply because he scales insanely well off of building attack speed items and lifesteal items. Plus the recent buff to his ult is actually HUGE as it gives him considerable engage power, safety and damage because of the full proc of his passive (hes always been able to but it isn't always consistent that his passive is fully charged like it is now pretty much and consistency is very, very important). He definitely needs a little identity though. They went for kind of a "tank from sustaining"  but it turned into "awkward bruiser that does to much damage to be a full tank but not enough to be meaningful".

Aatrox's problem is a lack of focus for the role they intend him to be, low base stats, and the fact that he needs to purchase so many different stats to be effective.  He's also got counter-play issues when he is strong because he'll use his E to waveclear and poke until you can no longer hold out versus him, while he heals for free.  Two attack speed steroids is also a different issue.  To be honest, I'd say he needs a rework in order to feel strong,  fair to play against, and to really emphasize what Aatrox is all about.  Unfortunately that type of work would be far off from now.
Tank Jungle Aatrox is strong atm. His Q is so useful and does good dmg without any dmg.
